Module chatRetry
Package stream

Class ClientManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • stream.ClientManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class ClientManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    ClientManager handles a client and sends its messages to all other connected clients Implements runnable to be executed in a thread.
    Author:
    Nathalie Lebon et Yousra Jebbari
    See Also:
    Client, Server

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ClientManager​(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
      Constructor of ClientManager.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void closeAll​(java.net.Socket socket, java.io.BufferedReader socIn, java.io.BufferedWriter socOut)
      In case of an exception or when a client disconnects, deletes the client manager, closes the buffered reader and writer and the socket of the client.
      void deleteClientManager()
      When a client disconnects, deletes the corresponding ClientManager from the client manager list and notifies the other connected clients.
      java.lang.String getClientUsername()  
      java.io.BufferedWriter getSocOut()  
      void loadTextHistory()
      Loads the message history from the file of path stored in messageHistory, and sends it to the client that just connected to the server.
      void run()
      Waits for a message to be sent by a client to send it to the other connected clients.
      void sendMessage​(java.lang.String text)
      Sends the parameter text to the other connected clients after saving it in the message history.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientManager

        public ClientManager​(java.net.Socket clientSocket)
        Constructor of ClientManager. Initializes the buffered reader and writer, the socket of the client, its username, and the path to the message history. Loads the message history and notifies the other connected clients of the new connection.
        Parameters:
        clientSocket - is the client socket that connects the client.
        See Also:
        sendMessage(String), loadTextHistory(), closeAll(Socket, BufferedReader, BufferedWriter), Client

    • Method Detail

      • getClientUsername

        public java.lang.String getClientUsername()

      • getSocOut

        public java.io.BufferedWriter getSocOut()

      • run

        public void run()
        Waits for a message to be sent by a client to send it to the other connected clients.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        See Also:
        sendMessage(String), closeAll(Socket, BufferedReader, BufferedWriter), Client

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String text)
        Sends the parameter text to the other connected clients after saving it in the message history.
        Parameters:
        text - is the String that will be sent to all clients except for the client that sent it.
        See Also:
        Client, closeAll(Socket, BufferedReader, BufferedWriter)

      • deleteClientManager

        public void deleteClientManager()
        When a client disconnects, deletes the corresponding ClientManager from the client manager list and notifies the other connected clients.
        See Also:
        sendMessage(String), Client

      • closeAll

        public void closeAll​(java.net.Socket socket,
                     java.io.BufferedReader socIn,
                     java.io.BufferedWriter socOut)
        In case of an exception or when a client disconnects, deletes the client manager, closes the buffered reader and writer and the socket of the client.
        Parameters:
        socket - is the client socket to be closed.
        socIn - is the BufferedReader of the client to be closed.
        socOut - is the BufferedWriter of the client to be closed.
        See Also:
        deleteClientManager()

      • loadTextHistory

        public void loadTextHistory()
        Loads the message history from the file of path stored in messageHistory, and sends it to the client that just connected to the server.
        See Also:
        sendMessage(String), closeAll(Socket, BufferedReader, BufferedWriter), Client
